page.title: 01Review of the 4 by 3km area.
page.content: The Newborough area is rural in character.The farmland is mainly arable.The landscape is flat and criss-crossed by drainage dykes. Only three roads cross the area in a north/south direction. The largest settlement is Newborough which is in the north-west corner of the 4 by 3km area.The population of the village as given in the 1981 census is 1110.The 1801 census cites the population figure as 129 and the 1901 census cites 682. The village is located four miles north of Peterborough. We have studied and written about the following aspects of life in the Newborough-transport,recreation, religion,trade and shopping,housing, farming,employment and social concerns.
